value.title: Convert JSON strings to tables in Power Query/ Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to convert JSON files in Power Query to a table easily, in basically 2 steps!!  Some additional resources: Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/preview/Sweden-Power-BI-User-Group/events/242804557  Import Json files from Erik: https://eriksvensen.wordpress.com/2014/09/15/specifying-json-query-in-power-query-example-statistics-sweden/

value.excerpt: Create and use custom visuals for Power BI in minutes!! In today's video, I am going to show you how you can use a custom visual we created

value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. value.title: Export Power Query data into SQL and do incremental refresh - Power BI Tips & Tricks #49

Really useful for example if you want to come around the limitiation of the lack of increment loads functionality in Power BI.  Some important links: BIInsight blog: http://biinsight.com/exporting-power-bi-data-to-sql-server/

value.title: Get data from zip files without extracting them in Power Query
value.excerpt: In today’s video, I will show you how to unzip files in Power BI. You will be able to import multiple zip files in Power Query and unzip them without having to extract them first.  Here is Marks blog, where you can find his function: http://sql10.blogspot.se/2016/06/reading-zip-files-in-powerquery-m.html
